implantes.description: Permanent and natural solution to replace lost teeth. Implants are artificial titanium roots that support dental crowns.

processSection.title: The Implant Placement Process
processSection.subtitle: A well-planned treatment for exceptional results.

01.title: Initial Evaluation

02.title: Digital Planning
02.description: Creation of a personalized treatment plan with 3D technology.

03.title: Placement Surgery
03.description: Minimally invasive procedure for implant placement.

04.title: Healing Period
04.description: 3-6 months for complete osseointegration of the implant to the bone.

05.title: Crown Placement
05.description: Installation of the definitive crown, customized for your smile.

1.a: The procedure is performed with local anesthesia, being virtually painless. Post-operative involves mild discomfort controlled with medication.

2.q: How long does an implant last?
2.a: With proper care, an implant can last a lifetime. The success rate is over 95%.

3.q: Can I get implants if I have little bone?
3.a: Yes, there are bone grafting techniques and special implants for cases of bone resorption.

higiene.title: How to maintain good daily oral hygiene
higiene.description: Practical habits for healthier teeth and gums: brushing technique, flossing, mouthwash, diet and when to see the dentist.

toc.title: In this article
toc.note: Need a personalized plan? We can evaluate your routine and recommend the best products and techniques.

higiene.lead: Small daily habits make a big difference. Here's a practical guide to keeping your teeth and gums healthy ‚Äî at home and between appointments.
higiene.keyTakeaway1: Brush 2√ó per day (2 min) + interdental cleaning
higiene.keyTakeaway2: Use fluoride toothpaste and replace brush every 3 months
higiene.keyTakeaway3: Regular check-ups every 6 months for early detection
higiene.whyText1: Oral health goes beyond aesthetics. Gum disease and cavities can cause pain and tooth loss, and they are associated with systemic conditions such as cardiovascular disease and diabetes.
higiene.whyText2: The good news? Prevention is simple with the right habits. Here's what truly makes a difference.

step1.title: Morning and night: brush for 2 minutes
step1.text: Use fluoride toothpaste and a soft-bristled toothbrush. Cover all surfaces ‚Äî outer, inner, and chewing surfaces.

step2.title: Interdental cleaning (1√ó per day)
step2.text: Use dental floss or interdental brushes. Ideally at night, before brushing.

step3.title: Optional: mouthwash/rinse
step3.text: Use only if recommended by your dentist. It does not replace brushing or interdental cleaning.

step4.title: Hydration and less sugar
step4.text: Drink water throughout the day. Avoid frequent snacking between meals, especially sugary foods.

higiene.tech1: Hold the toothbrush at a 45¬∞ angle to the gumline (where the tooth meets the gum).
higiene.tech2: Use short, gentle strokes ‚Äî avoid brushing too hard.
higiene.tech3: Brush the outer, inner, and chewing surfaces of all teeth.
higiene.tech4: Gently brush your tongue (or use a tongue scraper) to reduce bacteria and improve breath.
higiene.flossSectionText: Cavities and gum problems often start between teeth. If flossing is difficult, interdental brushes can be an excellent alternative ‚Äî ask your dentist for the ideal size.
higiene.flossHowTitle: How to use dental floss (in 3 steps)
higiene.flossHow1: Use approximately 45 cm of floss, wrap around middle fingertips.
higiene.flossHow2: Insert carefully between teeth, curving in C-shape around each tooth.
higiene.flossHow3: Make up and down movements, cleaning both sides of the tooth.

diet.good2: Prefer snacks with less sugar (nuts, cheese, yogurt).
diet.good3: Chew sugar-free gum after meals (if appropriate) to stimulate saliva.
diet.limit2: Sipping sodas/juices slowly for a long time (constant acid exposure).
diet.limit3: Tobacco (major risk for gum disease and stains).

higiene.warningSubtitle: If you notice any of these signs, consider booking an evaluation:

warning.1: Gum bleeding when brushing or flossing
warning.5: Pain when chewing or jaw discomfort

faq.q1: If gums bleed, should I stop flossing?
faq.a1: Generally, no. Bleeding is often a sign of inflammation. Use floss gently and consistently; if it persists for 1‚Äì2 weeks, book an evaluation.
faq.a2: Not always. It can help in specific situations (gingivitis, high cavity risk). The base is brushing + interdental cleaning.
faq.a3: For many people, yes ‚Äî improves consistency and plaque removal. Technique remains important.

finalCta.title: Want a personalized oral hygiene plan?
finalCta.text: We can evaluate gum health, cavity risk and recommend products and techniques tailored to you.

implantes.title: Dental implants: complete guide
implantes.description: Everything you need to know about dental implants, from the procedure to recovery. Complete guide on implantology.

toc.title: In this article
toc.note: Want to know if you're a candidate for implants? Schedule a free evaluation.

implantes.lead: Dental implants are a permanent solution for replacing missing teeth. Here's everything you need to know before making your decision.

takeaways.title: Key takeaways
takeaways.two: Can last a lifetime with proper care
takeaways.three: Preserve the jawbone and adjacent teeth

implantes.whatText: A dental implant is a titanium screw surgically placed in the jawbone to replace the root of a missing tooth. After osseointegration (fusion with bone), a crown is attached that looks and functions like a natural tooth.

implant.title: Implant
implant.text: Titanium screw inserted into the bone

abutment.title: Abutment
abutment.text: Connecting piece between the implant and the crown

advantages.2: Durability ‚Äî can last a lifetime with proper care
advantages.5: Allow you to eat and speak normally
advantages.6: Do not require removal for cleaning
advantages.7: Improve self-esteem and quality of life

implantes.eligibilityText1: Most adults in good general health can receive dental implants. However, a careful evaluation is required to determine whether you are a good candidate.
implantes.eligibilityText2: Factors that can affect eligibility include:

eligibility.1: Amount and quality of available bone
eligibility.2: General health and medical conditions (diabetes, osteoporosis)

phase1.title: Phase 1: Evaluation and planning
phase1.text: The dentist performs detailed clinical and radiographic examinations, including a 3D CT scan, to assess the bone and plan the ideal implant position.

phase2.title: Phase 2: Implant placement
phase2.text: Under local anesthesia, the implant is inserted into the bone. The procedure is usually painless. A temporary tooth may be placed the same day (immediate loading) in selected cases.

phase3.title: Phase 3: Osseointegration
phase3.text: Over 3 to 6 months, the bone integrates with the implant. This period is crucial for long-term success.

phase4.title: Phase 4: Final crown placement
phase4.text: After healing, the abutment and the final crown are placed, custom-made to match your natural teeth perfectly.

recovery.1: Some swelling and mild discomfort may occur
recovery.3: Avoid hard foods on the operated area

implantes.successText: Dental implants have a success rate above 95% when properly performed and maintained. Longevity depends on oral hygiene and regular check-ups.
implantes.costText: While the initial cost may be higher than other options, implants are the most economical long-term solution due to their durability and lack of need for replacement.

finalCta.title: Ready to restore your smile?
finalCta.text: Schedule a free evaluation to determine if you're a candidate for dental implants.

estetica.title: Everything about teeth whitening
estetica.description: Learn about the different types of whitening and which is most suitable for your case. Complete guide on dental aesthetics.
estetica.lead: A white smile boosts confidence. Understand how professional whitening works and what to expect from treatment.

toc.title: In this article
toc.note: Want a whiter smile? We can evaluate your case and recommend the best option.

takeaways.title: Key points
takeaways.one: Professional whitening is safe and effective

estetica.causesText: Several factors can darken or stain teeth over time:

food.title: Food and drinks
food.text: Coffee, tea, red wine, sodas and some foods can stain teeth over time.

tobacco.title: Tobacco
tobacco.text: Smoking or chewing tobacco causes significant yellowing and brown stains.

age.title: Aging
age.text: With age, enamel wears thin, revealing the yellowish dentin underneath.

medication.title: Medications
medication.text: Some antibiotics and treatments can cause intrinsic discoloration.

hygiene.title: Poor hygiene
hygiene.text: Inadequate brushing and flossing allows plaque and stains to accumulate.

office.title: In-office whitening
office.text: Performed at the clinic with LED light activation. The most concentrated gel is applied for fast, visible results.
office.results: Results: Immediate, up to 8 shades lighter

home.title: At-home whitening
home.text: Custom trays made for you, used at home with professional whitening gel.
home.application: Application: A few hours per day or overnight

combined.title: Combined whitening
combined.text: Combines an in-office session with at-home maintenance, offering the best of both methods: fast, long-lasting results.

estetica.safetyText: Professional whitening is safe when performed correctly. The dentist evaluates oral health, protects gums and uses appropriate concentrations. It doesn't damage enamel and sensitivity is temporary.
estetica.durationText: Results typically last 1-2 years, depending on habits. Avoiding staining foods/drinks and maintaining good hygiene extends whitening.

aftercare.1: Avoid staining foods for 48 hours after treatment
aftercare.2: Use a straw for colored drinks
aftercare.3: Rinse mouth after consuming staining foods

faq.a1: Most people don't feel pain. Some may experience temporary sensitivity, which usually resolves in 24-48 hours.
faq.q2: How white will my teeth get?
faq.a2: Results vary by person. Generally, you can lighten 4-8 shades. Natural tooth color and stain type influence the outcome.
faq.a3: With good care, 1-2 years. Touch-ups can extend results. Avoiding staining habits helps maintain whiteness.

finalCta.title: Ready for a whiter smile?
finalCta.text: Schedule a free evaluation and discover which whitening is ideal for you.

odontopediatria.title: When to take children to the dentist?
odontopediatria.description: Find out the ideal age for the first appointment and how to prepare the little ones for the visit. Complete guide on pediatric dentistry.

toc.title: In this article
toc.note: Have questions about your child's oral health? Schedule a pediatric consultation.

odontopediatria.lead: The first dental visit is an important milestone. Learn when to start and how to make it a positive experience.
odontopediatria.idealAgeTitle: What is the ideal age for the first consultation?
odontopediatria.idealAgeText: The first visit to the dentist should take place when the first tooth erupts or, at the latest, by the child's first birthday. This initial consultation is essential for:

idealAge.1: Assess the development of teeth and jaws
idealAge.3: Guide parents on children's oral hygiene
idealAge.4: Create a positive relationship between the child and the dentist

odontopediatria.preparationTitle: How do I prepare my child for the appointment?

2.title: Read books:
2.text: There are children's stories about visits to the dentist.

3.title: Play dentist:
3.text: Simulate a home visit using mannequins.

4.title: Choose the right time:
4.text: Choose times when the child is rested.

during.2: Let the dentist communicate directly with the child.
during.3: Avoid making promises of exaggerated rewards.
during.4: Praise the child's behavior after the appointment.

bottle.title: Baby bottle tooth decay
bottle.text: These occur when a child falls asleep with a bottle of milk or juice in their mouth. To prevent them, clean their teeth after each feeding and avoid sugary drinks in the bottle.

thumb.title: Sucking your finger
thumb.text: It is natural in the early years, but should be discouraged after age 4 to avoid changes in tooth positioning and dental arch development.

trauma.title: Dental trauma
trauma.text: Falls and accidents are common in childhood. In case of dental trauma, seek immediate dental care, even if there appears to be no visible damage.

odontopediatria.hygieneTitle: Oral hygiene for children by age.

0to2.title: 0-2 years
0to2.text: Clean the gums with a damp gauze pad. When the first teeth appear, use a baby toothbrush with water.

2to6.title: 2-6 years
2to6.text: Use fluoride toothpaste (a pea-sized amount). Parents should supervise and assist with brushing.

6plus.title: 6+ years
6plus.text: The child can brush their teeth independently, but parents should supervise. Introduce flossing when the teeth begin to touch.

odontopediatria.frequencyTitle: How often should you go to the dentist?
odontopediatria.frequencyText: After the initial consultation, it is recommended to visit the dentist every 6 months for routine check-ups. This frequency allows for the early detection and treatment of problems, when they are easier to resolve.

finalCta.title: Schedule your child's first visit
finalCta.text: We create a welcoming and fun environment for children to have positive dental experiences.

faq.subtitle: Find answers to the most common questions about our services
faq.description: Find answers to the most common questions about our services.

hours.a: We are open Monday to Friday from 9am to 7pm, and Saturdays from 9am to 1pm. We are closed on Sundays and public holidays.

appointment.q: How can I book an appointment?
appointment.a: You can book through our website by clicking 'Book Appointment', calling our phone number, or sending a WhatsApp message. We can usually schedule appointments within 48 hours.

payments.q: What payment methods do you accept?
payments.a: We accept cash, debit cards, credit cards (Visa, Mastercard), MB Way and bank transfers. We also offer customized payment plans for more extensive treatments.

insurance.q: Do you work with health insurance?
insurance.a: Yes, we work with major insurance companies in Portugal. Please contact us with your insurance details so we can confirm coverage and procedures.

routine_duration.q: How long does a routine appointment take?
routine_duration.a: A routine appointment (check-up and cleaning) usually takes between 45 to 60 minutes. For the first appointment, we recommend booking around 90 minutes to include a complete evaluation and planning.

pain.a: We use modern anesthesia and sedation techniques to ensure maximum comfort. Most of our patients report little to no discomfort during procedures. We prioritize your well-being in all treatments.

kids_first_visit.q: At what age should I bring my child to the dentist?
kids_first_visit.a: We recommend the first dental visit soon after the first tooth appears, or at most by the first year of age. Early visits help establish good oral health habits and prevent future problems.

implant_duration.q: How long does an implant treatment take?
implant_duration.a: The complete process usually takes between 3 to 6 months, depending on the case. This includes implant placement, healing period (osseointegration) and placement of the final crown. In some cases, we can offer immediate loading solutions.

whitening.a: Yes, professional teeth whitening is completely safe when performed by qualified professionals. We use approved products and techniques that protect the enamel and gums, providing lasting and safe results.

booking.q: Do I need to pay in advance to book?
booking.a: No advance payment is required for routine appointments. For more complex treatments that require specific preparation, a deposit may be requested. We will always inform you in advance if this is the case.

cta.text: Didn't find the answer you were looking for?

contact.title: Come
contact.description: We're located in Quinta do Conde, with easy access and nearby parking. Get in touch with us.

cta.title: Book Your Appointment Today!
cta.description: Don't wait any longer to take care of your smile. Our team is ready to welcome you.
